originalText.text: I need to add "alt text" to many images in my galleries section. Squarespace won't update to allow this. FLUID ENGINE FOR BLOG PLEASE! Classic editor for blog is not doing it for me and is dated. I would create my blog posts within a portfolio but the problem I found is portfolio limits you to 60 sub-pages. Fluid engine makes adding alt text to blog posts easier and it allows for me to display my posts in the grid:strips or the grid:masonry view which is amazing! The other alternative is to make the portfolio category have unlimited sub-pages. UNLIMITED SUB PAGES for Portfolio please. I must express my overall satisfaction with Squarespace as it has greatly facilitated my content management and uploads. I simply wish for these aforementioned features to be updated to further enhance everyone's experience. Also phone support would be great! Please start making more innovative updates!

originalText.text: This is a terrible company that just rip people off their money  and waste people time. I bought a domain from squares pace and tried using that on my google site. I tried connecting through the DNS setting as written in their help. But, none, worked. I reached out to the support team via email, no response. I have this project to complete but square space is making me look stupid before my clients. Be ware of this non responsive company

originalText.text:
Google domains redirected me to Squarespace, so I thought I would give them a try. They had a domain I wanted listed as available, so I signed up, gave them all my info (including cc) and registered it.

Moments later I get an email saying registration failed because that domain was not available.

Repeated this twice. Same results.

Not impressed.

EDIT to response below: I did open a ticket. No response to my email. Chat support said they had no agent. Finally got through on chat on fifth attempt. No resolution.

originalText.text:
I'm so frustrated!!! Such a shame of customer service!!!!! stay away from them!!!!! At October 30th I transferred my domain to Squarespace company from other company, Usually it takes few day to transfer the domain so I waited patiently. after a week I tried to connect my domain to my new website that I build in other country. It is a very common and easy process but it does'nt work. Something stuck at Squarespace and they doe'snt have any customer service!
I have no access to my domain, they don't have phone number, they don't have chat at the website, only emails.
I sent them more than 3 email but nobody answer me and I've got no response.
Meanwhile, my website not on air and it make me a huge problems at my business!!

originalText.text:
Squarespace’s acquisition of Google domains is a problem. My business is at a standstill because my domain has disappeared, causing my email and website to go down. I can’t get ahold of anyone, and their live chat is not helpful.

They boast that taking away phone communication and serving customers by email and live chat is a far better experience, but now trying to resolve an issue with them is like trying to resolve an issue with Google. It’s a dumpster fire.

Use another platform.
